name: Pass the Hash
description: Use captured NTLM hash to authenticate as the user without the need for the plaintext password.
execution: Identify systems that accept NTLM authentication.
Use tools like Mimikatz to extract hashes.
Leverage tools such as PsExec or Invoke-Mimikatz to perform pass-the-hash.
detection: Monitor for anomalous logon patterns and lateral movement with tools like Sysmon and SIEM solutions.

name: Remote Services
description: Utilize remote services such as SSH, RDP, or VNC to move laterally across systems.
applicability: Networks with remote services enabled and accessible.
execution: Obtain credentials through phishing, keylogging, or credential dumping.
Connect to the target system using the obtained credentials.
Establish persistence through service creation or scheduled tasks.
detection: Monitor for new remote connections and analyze logs for suspicious activity.

name: Exploitation of Vulnerability
description: Exploit known vulnerabilities in software or protocols to gain access to resources.
applicability: Systems with unpatched software or misconfigurations.
execution: Scan for vulnerable systems using tools like Nmap or Nessus.
Develop or obtain an exploit for the identified vulnerability.
Execute the exploit to gain access or escalate privileges.
detection: Implement vulnerability scanning and patch management strategies. Use IDS/IPS to detect exploit attempts.

name: Application Shimming
description: Leverage the Windows Application Compatibility Toolkit to execute code on system startup.
applicability: Windows systems with legacy compatibility requirements.
execution: Create a shim database with malicious payload.
Install the shim database on the target system.
The payload executes when the associated application starts.
detection: Monitor for changes to shim databases and unusual application behavior.

name: Taint Shared Content
description: Modify shared content to compromise systems that access it.
applicability: Networks with shared directories or development environments.
execution: Identify shared resources accessible by the target.
Inject malicious code into shared files or repositories.
Wait for the target to execute the tainted content.
detection: Use file integrity monitoring and access controls on shared resources.

name: Use of Admin Tools
description: Use legitimate administrative tools to move laterally and execute commands.
applicability: Networks where administrative tools are available and permitted.
execution: Gain access to an account with administrative privileges.
Use tools like PsExec, WinRM, or PowerShell for lateral movement.
Execute commands or deploy payloads using these tools.
detection: Monitor and whitelist administrative tool usage. Analyze behavior patterns for anomalies.
